{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3574919,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T14:48:51.321Z","cooked":"

For those of you who did not or could not acquire a Limelight 4 what models and or settings are you using for optimal Coral tracking?

We have multiple Limelight 3 units and are trying to get it to work well just for auton coral tracking. It seems like we get pretty mid to bad performance with a neutral color image where the detector refuses to see sideways oriented coral at all.

In the worst case it sees things that aren’t coral as coral…. Like for example my head

IMG_07213024×4032 1.44 MB

We are using the latest 2025.1 firmware and Google Coral model from limelight at the moment.

are you using the neural detector model?

To explain further into just settings
We have tried things from a fairly normal neutral color image to one made very dark where only the white of the coral is visible.

We have tried confidence in the range of 0.3 to 0.7 and can’t seem to find a happy range where it sees both vertically oriented floor coral and horizontally oriented floor coral. As soon as a piece looks mostly horizontal it stops being seen as coral.

Weirdly before the close of shop on Saturday I red shifted the entire image by cranking up a lot of camera red balance, exposure and black shift settings to near max and suddenly it did seem to work a little better, but I’m wondering what the experience of others has been.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-31T14:58:27.931Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497534,"topic_slug":"limelight-3-google-coral-optimal-settings","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3-google-coral-optimal-settings/497534/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3574961,"name":"Kevin Forbes","username":"TheOtherGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/theotherguy/{size}/160832_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T15:15:00.270Z","cooked":"

We’ve been working on coral vision recently and have hit the same problem. The Limelight model doesn’t appear to detect perfectly horizontal coral, and we have to turn the confidence down to the point of many false positives. Can’t say we found any more useful settings yet, just that in our testing it’s not been much of an issue since there are usually many coral on the ground and they are rarely exactly horizontal.

@Brandon_Hjelstrom
Sidenote…
Is there a possibility that upgraded Limelight 3s could be given an image that allows us to use the better camera but also maintain the ability for use of the Google Coral. When I upgrade a Limelight 3 to the global shutter camera I’m forced to use a Limelight 3G OS image… which doesn’t support the coral because that hardware subset doesn’t have the USB port.
